title: My first four games on live with new Sona
body:
These were all teambuilder with just me by myself as Sona Support Bot Lane. 

1)  [This game](http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/1475230469/48546) doesn't really count. It was against presumably a five stack who all went support champs mid and surrendered.

2) [This game](http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/1475251834/48546) was exactly as I feared. First thing that happened was that Leona hit E as soon as I went up to poke her, resulting in me losing 3/4 of my health from that and the ensuing Jinx autos. I basically never recovered from that, as it made me and Kog too low to fight back, though I did chase Leona way too far and got baited into the enemy Udyr at one point. Yeah, Trynd ragequit and Ori AFKed at fountain, but we were losing anyway.

3) I got FB in [this game](http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/1475252938/48546) because Ashe guaranteed crit plus auto Q power chord hurts a bit at level 1. Didn't do badly in laning phase, but Ashe farmed terribly and rushed a BT, resulting in Draven completely owning us as soon as he and Morg hit six. Couldn't do much to help Ashe if she got caught, my shield wasn't strong enough to guard against Draven, and if I got caught, well, GG.  Yasuo got fed, too, and I had trouble dodging when I had to stay close to my ADC to be the most useful.

4) I'm tempted to discount [this game](http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/1475254240/48546) because it got ridiculously laggy near the end (like, their Noct simply couldn't move, that laggy) but we were ahead before that so I'll count it. Laning phase was decent, though I gave up trying to poke them and just stuck to keeping Jinx alive. Ali's flash+pulverize+headbutt was more than I could deal with, and until I got Mikhael's so was Ashe ult. 

The things common to all four games: Sona's too squishy. Like, I know I'm not blowing anyone's minds here, but Sona's far too squishy to be a poke mage and she doesn't heal enough to be a sustain mage. Teamfights were a mess; I stuck with my ADC and hoped that no AoE came our way. My Q-power chord didn't feel like it did anything anymore; I tried poking the enemy Leona and Alistar, but it just didn't seem like I did anything. I still kept running out of mana. 

In conclusion, I don't know why this came off of the PBE. It doesn't seem done, and this is just as frustrating on live as it was on the PBE.

And pretty much meshes with what a lot of us were saying when we were reading what the adjustments were on the PBE.

They reduced her mobility, her early durability, and her resistances. And then for good measure hammered her damage combo potential if she dares to do it without at least one ally involved. I'm presuming that last one was to make it basically suicidal to attempt playing her someplace like mid-lane so that she *has* to be a good little support and be forced to stay firmly in bottom lane. And not trouble the Devs with being potentially better as a mid than support, you know where she could actually get enough AP to use her scaling to good effect.

Which is why Fearless if you read this... you have nice large swathes of the Sona population upset with you.
he's already said he will ignore whatever "feedback" he wants and will do what he wants since hes one of the devs >.>

That's a little unfair. It's obvious that he was surprised and hurt by some of the feedback he received. Much of it was personal. He even makes reference to having been called a monkey.

He didn't close off communication because he was being arrogant or elitist. He decided to ignore us because his feelings were hurt. I think the difference is really important.

This is really inaccurate. I dropped off the feedback to get Sona in better shape for release, and while I was reading and testing for and against the feedback on PBE, I did poor job of letting people know they were being heard, even as I was experimenting with changes to address their feedback. I dropped the ball on letting people know they were heard, but I did not ignore anyone. 

As I've said, one of the reasons I agreed to take on the Sona project is because I have a very thick skin and was totally ready to tank all the feedback, from the really educated, thoughtful stuff to the hate and venom people like Luner are going for. I still hope those people will at least give Sona a chance, but at the bare minimum, I'm doing my best now to be present here and let them know they've been heard.

In regards to Feedback, mind if I make a suggestion?


Give Rioters a special button to indicate you "Read" a post. This will be useful for ALL future communication to really show people you read their feedbacks. This way people won't sit there not knowing whether their voice was heard or not. No more miscommunication, and no more bumping not knowing whether their thread was drowned out too fast or whether it was read and taken into consideration.

Interesting idea, but I think our community deserves more than that. It's been very educational for me to see that pretty simple responses make people feel a lot better. The button could do that, but usage could be problematic. I know I'll personally be working hitting the level that I've come to understand people appreciate, even when I can't make substantial comments. This is also something I've already talked with in small conversations, but will be something that I try to pass on in general.

If you care to listen to my oppinion on the new sona (I am from EUW and only using this account to post on US forums), I am actually quite happy with the way sona turned out. I feel really impactful in later teamfights and there was more than one situation where my teammates actually realized that it was sona who saved them just right now (opposed to before where you had all that stats but noone would relize they just survived due to the massive resistance bonus).  
I only have a minor complain, which is that with q+powerchord AA (+q amplification) + eventual ADC hits you have a really high damage potential on level one and sonas early level poke is just a bit too high. I had situations in which I would take about 40% of the adcs max hp with one q poke.

So overall I am really happy about the rework. Sona feels more impactful and it is more clear when she is actually performing, but she might need a little tweak on her early game poke (not so much for the later stages of the game). Thanks for bringing us that rework!

I tried playing around with her first in a custom with a bunch of bots as company before trying her in pvp. I played my first 4 pvp games as new Sona yesterday (went solo queue). I went 3-1 win-lose, granted they were all team builder where people are encouraged to try new things so it was highly likely no one was playing the best they had to offer. I also felt my adc was better than the opposing adc for all of the games.

I don't like the new Sona. I liked Sona because she could use a lot more of the space she is given. I enjoy playing ranged champs like Lux. I don't like playing bruisers. I like ranged champs because I like having more room to work with, but the decrease in Sona's range significantly decreased the amount of room I could work with. I noticed in lane I couldn't go to a lot of the positions I wanted because I'd be out of range to tag my adc in case there was a sudden need to (i.e. sudden engage). For the first time as a support I felt *leashed*, and it felt really REALLY bad.

I could really feel the longer cooldowns too whenever a skirmish broke out because I would want to renew benefits but couldn't and it turned into an aa match with my puny support aa, and the fact that cooldowns are staggered makes it a lot harder than before to continuously chord properly. There wasn't a single skirmish during laning that both my adc and I were alive by the end of it iirc, and if I did survive the skirmish I'd have less than 100hp pretty much every time, while the surviving member on the other side would still be at least half health. I also felt less pokey because my positioning was so heavily constricted by that of my adc's as a result of the range decrease.

While the new Sona encourages more and better teamwork, I felt a lot of my independence was taken away. Yes, a support is supposed to help their team, but that doesn't mean we have to be completely dependent on them. We can go clear wards or wander around placing them and be reasonably safe. But the balance in Sona's kit factors in so many things that have to do with her allies making use of them she really can't do anything on her own, where as Janna, Lulu, Soraka, Nami, can all use their abilities on themselves for huge benefits and be independent. Old Sona was okay because her auras were persistent, but alone new Sona's benefits don't last long enough for her to be alone. If old Sona was being chased she could give herself a persistent speed boost and spam e chords to kite. If new Sona is being chased as soon as her speed boost wears out she's pretty much dead since her long cds don't allow her to chord kite or renew her boost frequently enough to get her out.

Also, for one of my games a teammate was chasing after an enemy and I was on the other side of the tree line. I felt really sad and useless when before I could help them by speed boosting them over the tree line, but now because of the range decrease I couldn't do anything to help.

While new Sona can still function and win games, I do feel the rework was a nerf, and I do feel this new Sona is not Sona, and conceptually she's been tarnished at the very least.

Since a sample size of 4 isn't large enough I will be playing more. I will try to get some games outside of team builder as well, but she is definitely no longer my go-to support and I will highly likely be picking up a new support in her place. =[
